item.title: UGENE 38.1 has been released
item.description:
Several important errors have been fixed:

  • Failure on the UGENE opening on Windows;
  • Small font on Linux;

    • If you are not able to run UGENE because of the failure, please, go to  the download page or (if UGENE has been installed with the Online-Installer) run the “setup.exe” file from the root directory.



    Read more here: UGENE 38.1 has been released

item.title: UGENE podcast #58: What’s new in UGENE 36, 37 and 38.
item.description:
In this video, we consider the innovations that have appeared in versions 36, 37 and 38. Over the past three versions, Multiple Alignment Editor has had the most part of the improvements.



Read more here: 58: What’s new in UGENE 36, 37 and 38.

item.title: UGENE 38 has been released
item.description:
New version improvements:

  • Alignment Editor:
    • The “Export amino translations” feature allows you to include gaps and choose a translation frame;
    • Minimum font size has been decreased (more comfortable for high resolution monitors);
    • “Sort by name” and “Sort by length” features have been improved and now they work not only for the whole alignment, but for selected sequences;
    • The “Sort by the number of leading gaps” feature has been implemented;
    • The “Cut” option has been implemented;
  • Sanger Reads Editor:
    • Double-click (also “Space” or “Enter” works too) on a read name now centers the meaningful symbols of the read on a screen;

A complete list of changes can be found here. See also the new video about UGENE 36, 37 and 38 improvements.



Read more here: UGENE 38 has been released

item.title: UGENE podcast #57: What’s new in UGENE 33, 34 and 35, part 2.
item.description:
We continue to inform you about improvements in UGENE versions 33, 34, and 35. In this video, we consider major changes in the Alignment Editor and Sequence View.



Read more here: 57: What’s new in UGENE 33, 34 and 35, part 2.

item.title: UGENE 37 has been released
item.description:
New version improvements:

  • External Tools “Trimmomatic”, “BWA” и “Bowtie2” have been updated on all operating systems;
  • Has been improved and sped up the validation process of External Tools in general, and of some particular Tools;
  • The visualization order of External Tools has been changed to the alphabetical order to simplify the navigation process;
  • The copy/paste algorithm and the naming principle have been improved in the Alignment Editor window;
  • The objects naming has been improved in the Project View.
A complete list of changes can be found here.
See also the second video about UGENE 33, 34, and 35 improvements.


Read more here: UGENE 37 has been released

item.title: UGENE podcast #56: What’s new in UGENE 33, 34 and 35, part 1.
item.description:
Here we briefly introduce you into major features and improvements in UGENE versions 33, 34, and 35. In the first part, we consider the improved mechanism of “External tools” importing, and their integration into the Workflow Designer.



Read more here: 56: What’s new in UGENE 33, 34 and 35, part 1.

item.title: UGENE 36 has been released
item.description:
Changes in the release include:

  • Shared database: support for MySQL version 8;
  • Phylogeny: improved tree visualization;
  • Sequence view: “Copy annotation” behavior is revised;
  • Workflow Designer: copied Dashboards now opens correctly;
  • User interface: an option to add a Desktop icon from Help menu.
A complete list of changes can be found here.
See also a new video about recent improvements in UGENE.


Read more here: UGENE 36 has been released
